newsitem.title: USA: Gaylord buys Word Records, price rises.
newsitem.headline: Gaylord buys Word Records, price rises.

text.p: Gaylord Entertainment Co on Tuesday said it completed the purchase of Word Records and Music from Thomas Nelson Inc.

The initial purchase price of $110 million, which included working capital and all other assets, was increased to about $120 million because of "an expected seasonal increase in the working capital of the business," Gaylord said.
Word Records and Music has annual sales of about $100 million, making it one of the largest contemporary Christian music companies in the world, according to Gaylord's press release.
Word Records comprises nine record labels and a music publishing business with more than 40,000 songs. The company will become an operating division of Gaylord.
